abstracts.cdata!:
The taking of land and related assets
            may take place only after compensation has been paid and
            where applicable, resettlement sites, new homes, related
            infrastructure, public services, and moving allowances have
            been provided to displaced persons. Furthermore where
            relocation or loss of shelter occurs, measures to assist
            displaced persons are implemented in accordance with the
            resettlement plan of action. Also, land acquisition should
            be done in a way that satisfies public health requirements.
            Likely displaced persons will include 1) individuals who
            suffer loss of assets or investments, land or property,
            and/or access to natural and/or economic resources; 2)
            households who include members affected by such losses--that
            includes dependent relatives, friends, or tenants; 3)
            vulnerable individuals too old or ill to farm; 4) members of
            households who may not eat together but provide housekeeping
            or reproductive services critical to maintaining the family;
            and 4) other vulnerable persons. Because of the atrocities
            committed during the war, vulnerable households and persons
            such as internally displaced people like orphans, amputees,
            the elderly, and female heads of households may have
            different needs from most households or persons or needs
            unrelated to the amount of land available to them.
            Compensation would take the form of ensuring they are not
            separated from dependents or persons/s upon whom they depend
            for support; and rehabilitation and training to acquire
            vocational skills.
